summary:
I am an IT profressioinal with 25+ years experience in telecommunications industry and a solid understanding of related technologies such as switching & routing, load balancing & identity service engines.

Project Management, Delivery and Implementation
- Design and implementation of a global Unified Communications platform, providing voice, video and collaboration services to enterprise offices in the Netherlands, UK, Hungary and the US.
- Implementation of a global enterprise wireless solution, providing guest and enterprise access.

Vendor and Partner management
- Experience leading virtual teams consisting of local IT, vendor & integrator staff on complex projects.

Technology domains
- Cisco Unified Communications Manager, Unity Connecton
- Cisco Unified Contact Centre Express, Finesse
- Cisco Telepresence server, Conductor, Meeting Server
- Cisco Telepresence Management System (TMS, TMSXE, TMSPE)
- Cisco VCS, Expressway
- Cisco Identity Services Engine (ISE)
- Cisco Prime Infrastructure, Collaboration suite
- Cisco WebEx
- Cisco routing and switching
- Microsoft Teams administration
- Avaya Communication Manager, SIP Enablement Server
- Avaya Meeting Exchange
- F5 BigIP load balancers
- Siemens Hicom, HiPath

I have a "get things done" mentality and can work independently while still remaining a team player and am not afraid to share knowledge.

profile_positions.description:
Designed and implemented a global Cisco Meraki based wireless platform, providing Guest and Enterprise wireless services  to enterprise offices in the Netherlands, UK, Denver & San Jose.

Designed and implemented a global Cisco UCM based Unified Communications platform, providing voice, video, collaboration and messaging services to enterprise offices in the Netherlands, UK, Hungary, Denver & San Jose.

Implemented self-provisioning and monitoring of the implemented UC platforms using the Cisco Prime Collaboration  platforms.

Providing consultancy and 3rd-level support for Voice, Video & WiFi portfolio in Liberty Global globally.
Generating High level and Low level design documents.
Vendor and project management in any new/ongoing projects.
Keeping up vendor relations.
profile_positions.title: Engineer IT Communications Systems

profile_positions.description:
As a result of organisational changes, became part of a team that mixed engineering and operations in an engineering role. While mostly concentrating on voice and video work, my previous routing and switching experience was further improved and I became the F5 load balancer go-to engineer.

This change also lead me to get heavily involved in the Cisco classic wireless environments consisting of Cisco WLC controllers & Prime Infrastucture as a management and alerting tool and ended up with managing 3 separate environments in HQ and 2 operating countries

Worked with internal and external teams to determine best methods of load balancing, including SSL offloading, and complex load balancing methods employing iRules to determine the best host to send traffic to.

During the investigations to a replacement telephony systems for the sites, trialed and worked with Avaya Communications Manager, Microsoft Lync/Skype for Business and Cisco UCM

Implemented a global Video Conferencing/Telepresence system for all of our European operations (13 countries in total) and various sites in the US. This was Tandberg based and used mostly T3 and C-series codecs with VCS and MSE8000 back-end for conferencing.

Implemented Cisco UCM telephony system with centralized SIP trunking to replace the legacy Siemens PaBX systems.
profile_positions.title: System Engineer

profile_positions.description:
Starting out as a team leader to a 3-person telephony team, responsible for the daily Moves, Adds and Changes at the corporate HQ consisting of 3 networked PaBX's in a very challenging and ever-changing environment.

After having handed over the telecom's team operations to the local IT team, I continued to focus on improving the telephony operations and decreasing overall telecoms cost in a series of projects for which I did all project management tasks. Maintained vendor relationships in both fixed and mobile telephony.

Implemented an in-house audio conferencing facility, based on Avaya Meeting Exchange, enabling the company to greatly decrease 3rd-party conferencing cost.

Implemented and operated a central SSL Certificate function for the companies certificate needs across 13 European operations. Vendor selection and negotiation, certificate life cycle management.
profile_positions.title: ICT Infrastructure Specialist

profile_positions.description: Founder and partner of a web-hosting company, providing hosting services for residential and small businesses. Mostly involved in the technical side of things, keeping the servers running and secure.
profile_positions.title: Owner

profile_positions.description:
At UPC Nederland, I started out in Amsterdam performing daily Moves, Adds and Changes on the networked PaBX's in 5 regions. Working with the local IT departments who would perform the local activities.

If and when issues arose, I would work with the local IT teams & Vendors to determine the root cause of these issues and work to resolve those issues in a timely manner so office and contact center operations could continue as normal.
profile_positions.title: Telecom specialist

profile_positions.description:
After Landis acquired Ansacom, I continued working in the telecoms world but was able to add some networking skills.

I added VoIP skills and frequently helped out my networking colleagues if any issues arose in the VoIP implementations.
profile_positions.title: Sr. Telecom Engineer

profile_positions.description:
As a Telecom Specialist at Ansacom, a Siemens/Ascom distributor, I translated the requirements of our dealers' customers (residential and smb) into a PaBX configuration and in most cases implemented these configurations to a variety of systems.

If and when issues arose, I often helped out our dealers determine the root cause and worked to resolve these issues, either remote or on customer locations.

Additionally, I helped train the system engineers of our dealers on Siemens, Ascom, Kirk and TipTel products. 

Areas I would work in are legacy telephony services, analogue and digital PaBX systems and DECT wireless systems.
profile_positions.title: Telecom specialist
